questions: Q. 1. Write the name of the products formed by heating gypsum at 373K. Write one use of it.
answers: Ans. Plaster of Paris and water. Use– It is used for plastering fractured bone.½ + ½

questions: Q. 2. Write an equation to show the reaction between Plaster of Paris and water.  → CaSO4.2H2O
answers: Ans. CaSO4.½ H2O + 1½ H2O  Plaster of Paris Gypsum

questions: Q. 3. Name a salt which does not contain water of crystallisation. [Board Term-I Set (C2), 2010]  (1 mark each)
Q. 4. Name two constituents of Baking Powder.
answers: Ans. Baking powder is a mixture of baking soda and a mild edible acid like tartaric acid.

questions: Q. 5. How would you distinguish between baking powder and washing soda by heating ?
answers: Ans. Baking powder (NaHCO3) on heating produces carbon dioxide which extinguishes a burning matchstick. It also give sodium carbonate and water vapour. 2NaHCO3 ∆ → Na2CO3 + CO2 + H2O When washing soda (Na2CO3. 10 H2O) is heated it does not produce carbon dioxide but it loses water of Crystallisation molecules. Na2CO3. 10H2O  → Na2CO3 + 10 H2O

questions: Q. 5. Name the sodium compound which is used for softening hard water.
Q. 6. Which by-product of chloralkali process is used for manufacturing bleaching powder ?
answers: Ans. Bleaching powder is produced by the action of chlorine on dry slaked lime.

questions: Q. 7. What is the common name of the compound CaOCl2 ?
Q. 8. What would be the colour of litmus in a solution of sodium carbonate ? [Board Term-I Set (C2), 2010]
answers: Ans. The colour of litmus in a solution of sodium carbonate is blue.

questions: Q. 9. Plaster of Paris should be stored in a moisture proof container. Explain why ?
answers: Ans. The Plaster of Paris should be stored in a moistureproof container as it absorbs water from moisture and turn into hard substance (Gypsum) as shown in the following chemical equation. CaSO4. H2O + 1 H2O → CaSO4. 2H2O (Plaster of Paris)
